721305f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, north from and including 40th Street, showing the newly erected Johns Manville Building on the S.W. corner of 41st Street. The houses on the N.W. corner of 41st Street will be demolished in 1919. The Manhattan Hotel is shown on the N.W. corner of 42nd Street; opposite it on the southwest corner the Central Trust or Union Carbide building will be erected about 1914. Part of old St. Bartholomew's Church, to be demolished in 1919, may be seen beyond on the S.W. corner of 44th Street. The buildings on the N.E. corner of 40th Street will stand till nearly
1925.
About 1912.

721309f.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, foc. E. 40th te 41st Streets.
Wurts Brothers  1925

712634f-a.text:
10 East 40th Street, excavation for a new skyscraper, south side, between Madison and Fifth Avenues, showing Nos. 14, 10, 6-8
East 39th Street.
December 14, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

712635f-a.text:
40th Street, south side, west from and including Madison, to and including Fifth Aves. Also shown is Madison Ave., at the S.W. corner of 40th Street.
About 1922.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

721306f.text:
Madison Avenue, south from East 40th Street, showing prominently the easterly side of same. At 38th Street are the opposing Madison Club residence and the Heckscher Building. Behind the latter is B. Altman's Department Store. The Metropolitan Life Insurance Co. tower is partially obscured by the Cameron Building (34th Street).

May 18, 1924

Standard Photographic Service
Gift of Borough President of Manhattan

721307f.text:
291-93 Madison Avenue, east side, between 40th and 41st Streets. No. 291 is the old Williams Club. These buildings will give place
about 1925 to a large office building.
1921.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.

721308f-a.text:
Williams Club, 291 Madison Avenue, east side, between 40th and 41st Streets. The buildings shown were demolished in the middle 192O's
About 1922.

721304f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, S.W. corner at 4Oth Street. Before 1920 the building on the N.E. corner and the adjacent house will give way to a 23
story office building.
About 1917.
